name: ARMA: Combat Operations
description: Sequel to the highly successful Operation Flashpoint, ARMA: Combat Operations is a first person tactical military shooter on the PC with large elements of realism and simulation. This game features a blend of large-scale military conflict spread across large areas alongside the more close quartered battles.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Windows XP Processor: 2 GHz or better Intel or AMD processor, or equivalent. Game is functional on, but currently not optimized for, Dual-core CPU's.   Memory: 512 MB of RAM Graphics: nVidia Geforce FX with 128 MB RAM & Pixel Shader 2.0 or better, ATI Radeon 9500 with 128 MB of RAM Pixel Shader 2.0 or better DirectX Version: DirectX 9.0c Hard Drive: 3 GB of free space Recommended:  Processor: 3 GHz or better Intel or AMD processor, or equivalent. Game is functional on, but currently not optimized for, Dual-core CPU's. Memory: 1 GB of RAM Graphics: nVidia 6800 or better with at least 256 MB of onboard RAM, ATI X800 or better with at least 256 MB of onboard RAM

reviews.review_text: if you play Call of Duty this isnt for you  this is a battlefield game and a sim not a deathmatch  when your tired of playing kids games come visit arma
What's that? You want hyper-realism?  Trust me, no, you don't.  But on the off chance that you really, really, really do? This game will deliver in spades.

It dosent work on my computer ONLY! ONLY! because i have a laptop. If you have a desktop computer that can run the game, knock yourself out! I have played the demo, and it is a game of its own. There is really nothing like it out there.

For those of you that enjoyed the original Operation Flashpoint series of games on the PC, this is where to look for your next post Op Flash fix. After you're done enjoying this instalment you can also get Arma 2 and Arma 3.  Some say this is a very complicated game, but so was the original and by that I don't mean the console version (Dragon Rising and Red River) but OF: Cold War Crisis, Red Hammer and Resistance.  For those of you that may not know, Op Flash was the game to go to for your pre Call of Duty, or Battlefield days. that was catering to the (dare I use the term) modern warfare gaming needs, yes you may say Counter-Strike was there before Op Flash but it was focused on counter terrorist tactical combat, not all out war.
